result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Zuercher Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

treatment/counseling.

No alcohol or drugs whatsoever.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Timothy J Zuercher in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time - credit for 7 days -  STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 - apply bail and refund balance 
-- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs whatsoever.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Obtain GED or HSED.  DNA  surcharge is waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Timothy J Zuercher in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Rosario requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court addresses WCS letter. Defendant to comply with all orders of WCS. Court will give another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report the first business day after his release from custody.  Not to possess any prescriptions that are not his.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Zuercher in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Court sets $250.00 Cash bond.  Defense requests the next date be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Defense requests the defendant be allowed to make a non-collect call to try and secure funds for the bond.  Court grants request of one local non-collect call to try and secure the funds for the cash bond.
Bail/bond hearing on July 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Branch 9 ONLY.  Based on non-compliance letter dated July 10, 2014 from WCS.
